doc.after: A hang glider is a glider aircraft in which the pilot is ensconced in a harness suspended from the airframe and exercises control by shifting body weight in opposition to a control frame Most modern hang gliders are made of an aluminium alloy or composite framed fabric wing Pilots have the ability to soar for hours gain thousands of metres of altitude in thermal updrafts perform aerobatics and glide cross country for hundreds of kilometres
